intro: Physematium montividense, commonly known as the Montivideo spurge, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its distinctive yellowish-green leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments and can reach heights of up to 1 meter. Its latex is toxic and can cause skin irritation, making it important to handle with care. Physematium montividense is often found in coastal regions and is adapted to thrive in sandy or loamy soils.
